outline: Rob was upset about some things the city council was doing.
Rob was against them instituting permit parking on Rob's street.
Ruffles walked out.
Rob also spoke at several city council meetings.
Thankfully, Rob was able to prevent the measure from being implemented.
response:
Rob had always been an active member of his community, but lately, he'd been growing increasingly frustrated with the city council's decisions. They seemed to be making choices that benefited only a select few, leaving the rest of the residents to deal with the consequences.

One day, Rob received a notice in the mail that really got his blood boiling. The city council was planning to institute permit parking on his street, which would make it impossible for his friends and family to visit without jumping through hoops. Rob was outraged. He couldn't believe the council would even consider such a restrictive measure.

As he sat in his living room, fuming, his cat Ruffles walked out of the room, sensing Rob's distress. Rob took a deep breath and decided to take action. He began attending city council meetings, speaking out against the permit parking plan at every opportunity. He argued that it would unfairly burden residents and stifle community spirit.

At first, it seemed like his efforts were falling on deaf ears. The council members seemed determined to push through their plan, no matter the cost. But Rob refused to give up. He continued to attend meetings, rallying his neighbors and friends to join him in protest.

Finally, after weeks of persistence, the council members began to listen. They realized that the permit parking plan was not in the best interest of the community, and they voted to reject it. Rob was overjoyed. His efforts had paid off, and his street would remain free of permit parking.

As he walked home from the final meeting, Rob felt a sense of pride and accomplishment. He was grateful that he had taken a stand and fought for what he believed in. And as he opened the door to his living room, Ruffles sauntered back in, as if to say, "I knew you could do it, Rob."
eval_result:
70

The subplot of Ruffles walking out and then returning is moderately integrated into the main narrative. Ruffles' actions serve as a symbolic representation of Rob's emotional state and his journey throughout the story. However, the subplot is not indispensable to the main storyline, as the main plot could still function without it.

outline: Sam saw his brother Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich.
Sam thought it was the grossest thing Sam ever saw.
During Holly's senior year Holly was able to apply to graduate schools.
After many weeks, Sam reluctantly agreed to take a bite.

response:
Sam had always been close to his brother Barry, but there was one thing that drove a wedge between them - Barry's love for peanut butter and banana sandwiches. One day, Sam walked into the kitchen to see Barry devouring one of these abominations. Sam's face contorted in disgust as he watched Barry take a big bite, the peanut butter oozing out of the bread. It was, in Sam's opinion, the grossest thing he had ever seen.

As the days went by, Sam couldn't shake off the image of Barry's sandwich. He would often tease his brother about his unusual taste, but deep down, he was repulsed by the idea of eating something so strange. Meanwhile, their family friend Holly was going through a significant milestone - her senior year of college. She was busy applying to graduate schools, and Sam's family would often gather to discuss her progress and offer support.

Weeks turned into months, and Sam's aversion to peanut butter and banana sandwiches remained strong. However, Barry's persistence and good-natured teasing eventually wore him down. One day, Barry approached Sam with a sandwich in hand, saying, "Come on, Sam, just take one bite. It's not that bad, I promise!" Sam hesitated, but his brother's enthusiasm was infectious. He reluctantly agreed to take a bite.

As the flavors touched his tongue, Sam's initial revulsion gave way to surprise. It wasn't bad at all. In fact, it was quite good! The creamy peanut butter and sweet banana complemented each other perfectly. From that day on, Sam started eating peanut butter and banana sandwiches every week, much to Barry's delight. He would often joke that he had been missing out on a culinary wonder, and Barry would just smile, knowing that he had converted his brother into a fellow fan of the unusual sandwich.

Score: 10

The subplot of Holly applying to graduate schools is only minimally connected to the main narrative of Sam and Barry's relationship and their shared experience with peanut butter and banana sandwiches. Holly's subplot is mentioned only once and does not significantly impact or influence the main plot. outline: Cindy loves her coworkers but has never attended happy hour with them.

response:
Cindy loved her job and adored her coworkers, but there was one thing she had never done with them - attend happy hour. She had always been hesitant, thinking it was unprofessional to drink with the people she worked with every day.

One day, as she was sipping her morning coffee, Nellie, one of her coworkers, walked into the office covered head-to-toe in heavy wet sand. Cindy couldn't help but stare, and Nellie laughed, explaining that she had gone to the beach during her lunch break. The unusual sight sparked Cindy's curiosity, and she began to wonder what other fun things her coworkers did outside of work.

At lunchtime, her coworkers invited her to join them for happy hour that evening. Cindy hesitated, citing her concerns about professionalism. But her coworkers reassured her that it was just a casual gathering and that they would still respect her boundaries. After some convincing, Cindy decided to take the leap and join them.

As she walked into the bar, she was greeted by the familiar faces of her coworkers, all holding beers. Cindy felt a twinge of anxiety, wondering if she had made a mistake. But as she ordered a soda and began to chat with her coworkers, she started to relax and enjoy herself. They talked about everything from their weekends to their favorite TV shows, and Cindy realized that they were more than just colleagues - they were friends.

As the evening drew to a close, Cindy felt pleased with her decision to attend happy hour. She had been afraid of compromising her professionalism, but in reality, she had found a new way to connect with her coworkers. From now on, she looked forward to joining them for future social events, knowing that they would still respect her boundaries and appreciate her company.

80

The subplot of Nellie coming into the office covered in sand is quite integrated into the main narrative. outline: Larry awakes one night to a sound.
Larry gets up to see if anyone is around.
The only bad thing was that one of Kelly's broke.
Larry see's no one just Larry's family kitten.

response:
Larry lived a peaceful life with his family in a cozy little house on a quiet street. He loved his family dearly, especially his daughter Kelly, who was the light of his life. One night, as he was drifting off to sleep, Larry was suddenly awoken by a strange sound. He sat up in bed, his heart racing, and listened intently. The sound seemed to come from downstairs.

Larry threw off his covers and got out of bed to see if anyone was around (plot point 2). He tiptoed down the stairs, his eyes scanning the darkened rooms. The only sound was the creaking of the old wooden floorboards beneath his feet. He searched the living room, the kitchen, and even the backyard, but there was no one in sight.

As he turned to head back upstairs, Larry's gaze fell upon the coffee table. That's when he saw it – one of Kelly's favorite vases lay broken, its shards scattered all over the table (plot point 3). Larry's heart sank, and he felt a pang of concern. Who could have done this?

Just as he was starting to worry, Larry spotted their mischievous little kitten, Whiskers, sauntering out of the room. The kitten's guilty look said it all. Larry couldn't help but chuckle, relieved that the mystery was solved. It was just Whiskers being her playful self.

With the tension dissipated, Larry felt his eyelids growing heavy once more. He headed back to bed, feeling grateful for the simplicity of life's little mysteries (plot point 5). As he snuggled under the covers, he smiled, knowing that all was well in his world. With a contented sigh, Larry drifted off to sleep, surrounded by the comforting sounds of his family's slumber.
eval_result:
80

The subplot of Kelly's vase breaking is quite well integrated into the main narrative. It serves as the source of the strange sound that wakes Larry, leading him to investigate and discover the broken vase. This subplot also introduces the character of Whiskers, the kitten, and provides a resolution to the mystery of the sound. However, it doesn't significantly impact the overall narrative or the character's development, hence it doesn't score a perfect 100.

outline: Ronald was taking intro to Anatomy.
Ronald was grouped with three beautiful women.
Then Marcus suggested Marcus drink more water every day.
Ronald's face turned bright red as soon as the teacher started speaking.
The group giggled but Ronald learned quite a few things.
response:
Ronald nervously walked into his intro to Anatomy class, clutching his textbook and trying to make sense of the complex diagrams inside. He had always been fascinated by the human body, but he was worried that he wouldn't be able to keep up with the coursework.

As the teacher began to explain the group project, Ronald's anxiety spiked. He was grouped with three beautiful women, all of whom seemed to know exactly what they were doing. There was Sophia, the pre-med student with a quick wit and sharp tongue; Rachel, the athletic trainer with a toned physique and confident air; and Emily, the quiet but intense biology major with a passion for research. Ronald, on the other hand, felt like a fish out of water.

As they introduced themselves, Marcus, the teacher's assistant, walked by and suggested that Ronald drink more water every day to stay focused. Ronald nodded awkwardly, trying to play it cool.

But as soon as the teacher started speaking, Ronald's face turned bright red. He couldn't explain why, but the sound of her voice made him feel like he was going to pass out. The group giggled at his expense, and Ronald wanted to sink into his chair and disappear.

Despite his embarrassment, Ronald tried to focus on the lesson. And to his surprise, he learned quite a few things. He discovered the intricacies of the human circulatory system, the importance of the nervous system, and the complexity of the muscular system.

As the class drew to a close, Ronald reflected on what he had learned. He realized that despite his initial awkwardness, he had gained a new appreciation for the human body. And although he still felt a little intimidated by his group members, he was determined to prove himself as a valuable contributor to their project.

Score: 30

Laney felt her anger and frustration simmering just below the surface. That was when Corey, a coworker and friend, noticed Laney's distress and approached her.

"Hey, Laney, I've been researching meditation techniques, and I think I found one that might help you cope with the stress," Corey said, handing Laney a pamphlet. Laney was skeptical at first, but desperate for a solution, she decided to give it a try. Corey guided her through the exercises, and to Laney's surprise, she began to feel a sense of calm and inner strength that she had never experienced before.

But even with her newfound meditation practice, Laney couldn't shake off the feeling of being trapped in a toxic work environment. Finally, one day, she reached her breaking point. As Mr. Johnson yelled at her in front of the entire office, Laney stood up, looked him straight in the eye, and said, "I quit."

The room fell silent, and Laney felt a rush of adrenaline as she walked out of the office, leaving behind the toxic atmosphere and her miserable job. As she stepped into the bright sunlight, Laney felt a sense of pride and empowerment wash over her. She was glad she stood up for herself, for taking back control of her life. Laney realized that she had been living in a state of self-doubt and fear, but now, she was free to explore new possibilities and create a life that truly made her happy.

Gabe was a regular morning cyclist, pedaling his way to school every day. He loved the freedom and fresh air that came with it. However, one morning, his routine took an unexpected turn. As he was riding down the hill, he lost control and fell off his bike. The pavement was unforgiving, and Gabe scraped his knee and elbow.

Dazed and disoriented, Gabe lay on the ground, struggling to get up. Before he could do so, a kind neighbor, Mrs. Johnson, rushed to his side. She helped him sit up and examined his wounds. Realizing Gabe needed medical attention, she quickly called his mother.

Gabe's mother arrived promptly, concern etched on her face. She helped Gabe into the car and drove him to the doctor's office. The doctor examined Gabe's injuries and prescribed some rest and medication. Gabe's mother was relieved it wasn't more serious.

As they drove home, Gabe's mother mentioned that Marissa's parents were hosting a party at their house that weekend. Gabe had been looking forward to it, but now his injuries might make it difficult for him to attend. His mother reassured him they would make a decision closer to the party date.

The following days, Gabe took it easy, recuperating from his accident. On the day of the party, his mother decided he was well enough to attend. Gabe was thrilled and grateful. As they arrived at Marissa's house, he was greeted with concern and sympathy from his friends. Despite his bruises, Gabe had a great time, and the party became a memorable event.

In the end, Gabe learned a valuable lesson about being more careful on his bike, but he was also grateful for the kindness of his neighbor and the support of his friends. His daily routine might have been disrupted, but it ultimately led to a more appreciation for the people and experiences in his life.

Just then, a curious cat appeared from nowhere, its whiskers twitching as it sniffed the gummy bears. Anita giggled at the cat's antics, her hand still hovering over the container. The cat batted at the container, its paw swiping at the plastic lid.

Before Anita could react, the shopkeeper emerged from behind the counter, her eyes fixed on Anita with a stern glare. Anita felt a jolt of surprise, her hand snapping back to her side. The shopkeeper's expression implied accusation, as if Anita had been caught stealing. The cat, sensing the tension, darted away, disappearing behind a nearby shelf.

Anita never felt so guilty in her life. Her heart raced, and her face grew hot. She took a step back, her eyes fixed on the shopkeeper, wondering if she had misinterpreted the situation. The glare seemed to pierce through her, making her feel like a thief. Anita's guilt was palpable, weighing her down like a physical force. She quickly turned and fled the store, leaving the gummy bears and the shopkeeper's suspicions behind.

John stood in the pit lane, his heart racing with excitement as he gazed out at the sleek, high-performance cars. He had never raced cars professionally before, but he had always dreamed of doing so. Now, finally, he was about to take the wheel for his first race.

As he put on his helmet and gloves, John couldn't help but feel a sense of nervous energy. He had practiced for weeks, but he knew that nothing could fully prepare him for the real thing. Just then, Tom, a seasoned racing veteran, walked by and caught his eye.

"Hey, rookie," Tom said with a smirk. "You think you're ready for this?"

John nodded, trying to exude confidence. But Tom just chuckled and shook his head. "Everyone I talk to is an idiot," he muttered to himself as he walked away.

Despite Tom's skepticism, John was undeterred. He climbed into his car, started the engine, and prepared to take his place at the starting line.

The green flag waved, and the race was underway. John's nerves quickly gave way to focus as he navigated the twists and turns of the track. It wasn't easy – the other drivers were experienced and aggressive – but John held his own, making it through the entire race without incident.

As he crossed the finish line, John let out a sigh of relief. "I'm just glad I got all the way through it," he said to himself, grinning from ear to ear.

Despite some bumps along the way, John knew that this had been a good first step. He had faced his fears and come out on top. And as he climbed out of his car, he couldn't help but feel a sense of excitement for what the future held. He knew that he would continue to race, to push himself to be better, and to prove to himself and others that he had what it took to succeed.

response:
Sarah loved the winter. There was something magical about the snowflakes gently falling from the sky, the crisp air that invigorated her senses, and the serene silence that enveloped the world. But among all these wonders, one of Sarah's favorite things about this time was the trees. She marveled at how their bare branches, etched against the grey sky, seemed to come alive in the frosty air.

On one particularly gloomy winter morning, Tim thought the day would be ruined. The sky was a deep, foreboding grey, and the wind howled like a chorus of restless spirits. He grumbled to himself as he trudged through the snow, his eyes fixed on the ground.

Meanwhile, Sarah stared out the window, her gaze lost in the winter wonderland. She spent hours watching the snowflakes dance, the trees sway, and the world slow down. As the days turned into weeks, and the weeks into months, Sarah's habit of staring out the window became a ritual. She found solace in the stillness of the winter landscape, and the trees, with their skeletal beauty, seemed to whisper secrets of peace and tranquility to her.

As the winter slowly gave way to spring, Sarah's peaceful nature remained. The gentle rustle of the trees, the soft whisper of the snow, and the serene silence of the winter air had seeped into her soul, making her a more peaceful person. She carried this sense of calm with her, even as the world outside began to awaken from its winter slumber.

In the end, Sarah's love for winter, and especially the trees, had brought her a sense of tranquility that she would cherish forever. As she looked out the window, now filled with the vibrant colors of spring, she smiled, knowing that the peace she had found would stay with her, no matter the season.

It never ventured out, content to lounge in the sunbeams streaming through the windows or chase the occasional fly. Lisa made sure to keep the doors and windows securely closed, knowing that Ruffles' curiosity might get the better of it if given the chance.

Lisa listened intently, happy to see her friend so enthusiastic. As they sat in the living room, Ruffles curled up beside them, purring softly.

In the midst of their conversation, Lisa got up to refill their coffee cups, momentarily leaving the back door ajar. It was a small mistake, but one that would have significant consequences. Ruffles, sensing freedom, quietly slipped out of the house.

Lisa didn't notice Ruffles' escape until she heard a faint meowing sound coming from outside. Her heart skipped a beat as she rushed to the door, scanning the yard frantically. That's when she spotted Ruffles, hesitantly exploring the great outdoors. Without hesitation, Lisa dashed out, calling out to her beloved pet.

Luckily, Lisa caught Ruffles in time, scooping it up in her arms before it could wander further. She cradled Ruffles tightly, relief washing over her as she realized how close she had come to losing her furry companion. From that day on, Lisa made sure to double-check the doors and windows, ensuring Ruffles' safety and her own peace of mind.

As the sun began to set, Sally and Tommy counted their earnings. They beamed with pride when they saw the total: fifty-two dollars! They felt glad, knowing that their small effort could make a difference in the lives of the refugee family.

outline: Jason woke up to the sound of water.
It was coming from Jason's basement.
When Chris tried it Chris was amazed at how bright it was outside.

Jason called a plumber to fix everything.
response:
Jason woke up to the sound of water. At first, he thought it was just the shower running or the washing machine on a cycle, but as he sat up in bed, he realized the sound was coming from downstairs, specifically from his basement. He threw off the covers and rushed to investigate.

When he reached the basement door, he could hear the sound of rushing water more clearly. His heart sank as he slowly turned the handle and pushed the door open. The sight that greeted him was chaotic: the basement was totally flooded from a leak! Water was ankle-deep, and his storage boxes and furniture were soaked.

Jason's friend Chris, who was staying over, wandered into the kitchen, yawning. "What's going on?" he asked, noticing Jason's frantic expression. Jason filled him in on the situation, and Chris offered to take a look outside to see if there was any visible damage.

When Chris tried to open the back door, he was amazed at how bright it was outside. "Dude, it's like high noon out here!" he exclaimed. Jason shook his head, too worried about the flood to appreciate the unusual weather.

As the reality of the situation set in, Jason knew he had to act fast. The longer he waited, the more damage the water would cause. He quickly grabbed his phone and called a trusted plumber to come and fix everything. Within the hour, the plumber arrived, and Jason breathed a sigh of relief as the expert got to work fixing the leak and pumping out the water. As the chaos began to subside, Jason couldn't help but feel grateful for the prompt response and the promise of a dry, functional basement once again.
eval_result:
30

The subplot of Chris being amazed at how bright it is outside is only loosely connected to the main narrative. While Chris's presence and his decision to check outside for damage is related to the main plot, his observation about the brightness outside doesn't contribute significantly to the main storyline about the basement flooding.

outline: Maggie had been in trouble with the law when she was younger.

response:
Maggie had once been a wild child, always getting into trouble with the law. But that was before she met her husband, Dan, and settled down. After they got married and had a beautiful child, Emma, Maggie transformed into a devoted and loving mother. She was determined to provide a stable and happy life for her family.

However, as time passed, Dan began to feel suffocated by the monotony of their routine. He started to resent Maggie, feeling that she was holding him back. One day, he made the shocking announcement that he wanted a divorce and custody of Emma.

Maggie was devastated, but she refused to give up without a fight. She knew she had to prove herself as a capable and loving parent to the court. Meanwhile, Dan was determined to discredit Maggie and searched high and low for evidence to support his claims. He scoured stores, looking for any sign of Maggie's past misdeeds, but came up empty-handed.

Despite Dan's efforts, the judge was not swayed by Maggie's current good behavior. Her past mistakes loomed large in the judge's mind, and he ultimately ruled in favor of Dan, granting him full custody of Emma.

Maggie was crushed. The loss of her child was too much to bear. She felt like she had lost her purpose in life. Her world began to crumble, and she fell back into the old habits she had worked so hard to escape. She started hanging out with her old crowd, getting into trouble, and eventually, back into a life of crime.

As Maggie slipped deeper into her old ways, she couldn't help but think that the judge's ruling had been the catalyst for her downfall. If only he had seen the good in her, maybe she wouldn't have lost her way again. But now, it was too late. Maggie was back to her old self, and Emma was gone, lost to her forever.

85

The subplot of Dan searching for evidence of Maggie's past misdeeds is closely tied to the main narrative. outline: Lori was watching her aunt's house.

Lori was watching her aunt's house, which was a familiar routine for her. One thing that caught her attention, however, was her aunt's brand new car. It was sleek, shiny, and tempting. Without permission, Lori took the keys and drove the car out of the garage. She felt like a queen, cruising down the road with the wind in her hair and the sun on her face. She picked up her friend Sadie, who was thrilled to be seen with Lori and the new car. They headed to a party, where Sadie was hesitant to dance with another guy, preferring to stick with Lori and the attention-grabbing vehicle.

As the night wore on, Lori's confidence grew, and she decided to show off the car's features. She pulled into the driveway, revving the engine and spinning the wheels. But in her recklessness, she misjudged the distance and ran right into the garage door. The sound of crunching metal and shattering glass filled the air.

Lori was shocked and devastated as she surveyed the damage. The car was dented and scratched, and the garage door was badly damaged. She knew she was in trouble. When her aunt found out, she was furious. "There are a lot of damages, Lori," she said, shaking her head. "How could you be so careless?"

Lori was filled with regret and remorse. She took responsibility for her actions, promising to pay for the repairs and help with the cleanup. It was a hard lesson to learn, but Lori knew she had to be more careful and respectful of others' property. She vowed to be more mindful in the future, and to always think before acting.

When Tonya was ready to pay for it, Tonya was ten dollars short – or rather, Mary was. The reality of her situation hit Mary hard, and she got scared. Her heart racing, she quickly scrambled out of the bathtub, not thinking about her nudity.

outline: Joel was very stingy with his money.
And Joel always feared Joel would need to use it for an emergency.

Joel was a man who pinched pennies like they were going out of style. He was known among his friends for being extremely stingy with his money, always fearful that he would need it for an emergency. His friends, Lola and Max, would often tease him about his frugality, but Joel didn't budge. He believed that saving was the key to a secure future.

Just before a big trip to Europe, Lola and Max got into a huge fight. The tension was palpable, and their friends wondered if they would even make it to the airport together. Joel, however, remained focused on his savings. He had been dreaming of this trip for years, but he was more concerned about the cost than the potential fun.

Despite the drama between Lola and Max, Joel kept on saving money. He would crunch numbers in his head, calculating how much he could afford to spend on each meal, each souvenir, and each activity. His friends would try to convince him to splurge, but Joel wouldn't budge.

Years went by, and Joel continued to work and save. He became a master of frugality, always finding ways to cut costs and increase his savings. Finally, the day arrived when Joel retired. He had saved enough to live comfortably, but as he looked back on his life, he felt a pang of regret.

Why had he been so stingy? Why had he never taken the chance to enjoy his money? Joel realized that his fear of emergencies had held him back from truly living. He had missed out on so many experiences, so many memories, because of his obsession with saving.

As Joel reflected on his past, he came to a profound understanding. Balance was key. Saving was important, but so was living. He wished he could go back and tell his younger self to be more carefree, to splurge every now and then, to enjoy the fruits of his labor. But it was too late for that. All Joel could do was learn from his mistakes and try to make the most of his remaining years. He vowed to find a balance between saving and spending, to live life to the fullest, and to never let fear hold him back again.

Score: 20
